content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.104 - Executive order no. 104: establishing a task force on encouraging electoral participation

State Regulations
WHEREAS, This year we celebrate the bicentennial of the
founding of our Constitution; WHEREAS, The Constitution assigns a significant role in our
representative form of government to the people--that of selecting their public
officials through the electoral process; WHEREAS, Participating in the electoral process is a
fundamental right and civic duty that serves as the foundation of our democracy
and assures its success as a government of the people, by the people and for
the people; WHEREAS, It is a proper function of government to encourage
electoral participation by determining why registered voters fail to vote and
why eligible persons fail to register to vote, to eliminate unreasonable
obstacles to voting and registration and to create mechanisms that facilitate
voting and registration; WHEREAS, Efforts to encourage New Yorkers to vote and to
register have been taken through implementation of the recommendations of the

Temporary Commission on Voting Machine Equipment and Voter Registration Systems
and through implementing Executive Order No. 43 which facilitated voter
registration by mail; WHEREAS, Despite these efforts, approximately 40 percent of
those entitled to register to vote in New York State have failed to register
and the low levels of voter turnout experienced in New York State have not
improved materially and, accordingly, further efforts are necessary to
encourage New Yorkers to register to vote and to vote; and
WHEREAS, The creation of a task force to study citizen
participation in the New York State electoral system, examine the factors
relating to electoral participation and recommend steps that can be taken to
foster greater participation by all citizens in our electoral process will
invigorate our democracy and strengthen our governmental system: NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws
of the State of New York, do hereby order as follows: I. There is hereby created a Task Force on

Encouraging Electoral Participation, to be composed of 18 members appointed by
the Governor. The Chairperson of the Task Force shall be selected by the

Governor. II. The Task Force on

Encouraging Electoral Participation shall: (1)
determine, through public opinion research techniques, review of existing data
and analyses and other means, the reasons why eligible New Yorkers fail to vote
or to register and what steps would tend positively to affect public behavior
in those regards; (2)
review laws, rules, regulations, programs and procedures in other states and nations which
have a high percentage of voter participation in the electoral
process; (3)
review laws, rules, regulations, programs and procedures in this State relating to voting and voter
registration and recommend amendments thereof or improvements therein that will
increase voting and voter registration; and
(4)
report its findings and recommendations
to the Governor on or before February 15, 1988. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: November 2, 1987
